title: Breaking news in East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire - BBC News
summary: hull 's 'bee lady ' has birthday party at guildhall .
p & o cancels ferry sailings to zeebrugge today and tomorrow .
exam stress blamed for rise in calls to childline .

text: crystal palace 4-0 hull city

BBC Sport

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back with you monday morning from 08:00 .
before i go , lets have a look at five things we did n't know this morning :
today really belongs to one woman , hull 's bee lady jean bishop .
she has raised over £ 100,000 for charity .
happy birthday hull 's bee lady .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wolds way to air
text: a special programme highlighting the beauty of the east yorkshire wolds will be shown to a national tv audience this weekend .
part one of a two-part series called `` yorkshire wolds way '' will be on bbc 2 tomorrow evening .
it 's hosted by the adventurer and explorer paul rose
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weekend weather forecast : 'a mixed bag ' of weather
text: on saturday it will start off breezy with plenty of cloud and some patchy rain or drizzle .
it will become drier and brighter through the afternoon with some sunshine
on sunday there will be a mixture of sunshine and scattered heavy showers with some possibly becoming thundery .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hospital cyber attack update
text: the hull and east yorkshire hospitals trust has told the bbc that malware was detected on the computer centre but it has not had a significant impact on services .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull 2017 : time to get your free tickets
text: here 's a short video telling you some of the upcoming events and how to get your tickets .
do n't miss these @ twitterid ticket releases !
most of them are free , but do n't forget to book your tickets via
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hosptial cyber attack
text: nhs digital have sent out this statement in response to a cyber-attack on hospitals across the country .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: hospitals hit by 'large-scale cyber attack '
text: nhs services across england have been hit by it failure , believed to be caused by a large-scale cyber attack .
trusts and hospitals in london , blackburn , nottingham , cumbria and hertfordshire have been affected .
nhs england says they are aware of the issue and are looking into it .
the bbc is contacting local hospitals in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire to see if they 've been affected by the cyber attack .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull 's fountains could be finished by end of month
text: hull 's city council says it hopes new fountains in queen victoria square will be finished by the end of the month , if testing next week is successful .
the fountains are part of a £ 25m pound facelift of the city centre .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: two men arrested over man 's death in hull
text: two men have been arrested after a man was found dead in hull .
humberside police said it was called to an address on princes avenue shortly before 16:30 on thursday following the death of a 27-year-old man .
a 33-year-old and a 52-year-old have been held in connection with the man 's death and are in custody .
the victim is yet to be formally identified and enquiries are under way to establish the cause of his death , a spokesperson for the force said .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: hull 's bee lady celebrates 95th birthday
text: here are some photos from hull 's .
'bee lady ' jean bishop 's birthday .
radio humberside 's lizzie and carl hosted the party to celebrate jean 's birthday .
politicians including john prescott and alan johnson were full of praise for hull 's bee lady .
there was a special performance from local choir 'all for one . '
the room and cakes were decorated in yellow and black .
many people from hull and the surrounding area have sent jean cards wishing her many happy returns .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: concerns over a-level students suffering panic attacks
text: the number of children and teenagers who 're being referred to mental health services in the east riding is now at record levels .
and charities believe exam pressures are partly to blame .
many teenagers say the new a-level courses , where subjects are examined at the end of two years , are adding to their anxiety and stress .
justine wilkinson , a counsellor from wyke college , says she 's seen an increasing number of students suffering panic attacks :
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: challenge cup : salford red devils v hull kr
text: head coach tim sheens admits salford are the favourites going into the sixth round match , but the robins will go into the game showing plenty of spirit .
championship leaders hull kr , who were relegated by salford last season , have made three changes to the side that hammered batley 68-4 last week .
thomas minns , nick scruton and josh johnson come in for youngsters joe cator , brad clavering and joe wardill .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: water polo in decline
text: water polo in our region is on the decline .
the humberside water polo club are now the only team in east yorkshire and north lincolnshire , and have only just got back on track after their last training pool was closed .
they now play at the newly renovated albert avenue baths in hull , where competitive water polo has been taking place since the 1950s .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: plans for 'super prison ' submitted
text: plans for a new prison in east yorkshire have been submitted .
if given the go-ahead the new prison will be built on land next to the high-security full sutton jail , near pocklington .
the £ 91m building would hold 1,000 adult male prisoners and create an additional 245 jobs .
a total of 500 staff will need to run the prison
it 's part of government plans to invest £ 1.3bn in building new prisons on four sites across the uk .
the east riding of yorkshire council 's planning committee will now consider the plans .
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: challenge cup : hull fc v catalans dragons
text: hull fc take on catalans dragons tonight in the sixth round of the ladbrokes challenge cup .
the black and whites look to defend the title after winning the cup last year .
hull fc will recall prop scott taylor after he missed last week 's win over widnes as he was on international duty with england .
danny houghton also plays after coming back from injury in that game .
catalans head coach laurent frayssinous has 11 players out injured but half-back luke walsh has returned from his suspension
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: watch : humber street sesh announces line-up
text: the humber street sesh is holding a live launch to announce acts that will play at this year 's festival :
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

text: maguire delays talks over new hull deal

documents.title: humber street sesh announces headline acts
text: the humber street sesh has announced its headlines acts for this summer 's event .
the one day music festival , which showcase local music , will be held on saturday 5 august .
here 's our humber street sesh headliners !
@ lifebanduk headline @ twitterid main stage !
check out the full lineup at
@ twitterid bbc introducing 10.30-11pm .
yesss !
last year was great , but more toilets and drinking holes please , oh yes and the sun
we are over the moon to be performing at @ twitterid on august 5th this year !
w/ @ twitterid & @ twitterid # humberstreetsesh
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull 's bee lady celebrating her 95th birthday
text: we are live at the guildhall where hull 's bee lady jean bishop is celebrating her 95th birthday :
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police warn against opening your door to rogue traders
text: humberside police are urging householders not to open the door if they have any doubt about who the caller might be .
it 's in support of a national operation called rogue trader awareness week .
the aim is to raise awareness of distraction burglars or rogue traders on vulnerable residents .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: guildhall gets ready for 'bee lady ' birthday
text: final preparations made to celebrate hull bee lady jean bishop 's birthday .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull university library partly closed
text: hull university have announced they 've had to close several floors of their library immediately .
due to health and safety reasons we are having to close floors 2-7 immediately .
apologies for inconvenience caused
when will they be reopened ?
we 're working on the fix now and will let you know when sorted .
we 've opened the skills rooms on the ground floor as extra study space
oh god , what happened ?
nothing serious just a couple of faults with behind the scenes systems .
working on it now
hi .
if students are affected by the library closures , there is space in mr1 , mr3 and mr6 in student central
where else is open where we can login to computers ?
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: there 's lots of bee balloons for hull 's 'bee lady '
text: preparations for jean bishop 's 95th birthday are under way .
there 's a car full of bee balloons making its way to the guildhall .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concert to celebrate ties between hull and sierra leone
text: the relationship between hull and its twin city freetown in sierra leone is to be celebrated this summer at a concert showcasing the musical history of the two cities .
the event , which is .
part of hull 2017 's creative communities programme , will also feature real stories about the people of freetown .
the concert will be held at the kc lightstream in august .
`` the connection between hull and freetown is an important one , which has historically worked to strengthen the commercial , educational and cultural links between the two cities . ''
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: full list of election candidates released
text: a full list candidates for the general election has been announced .
hull west and hessle will have a new mp , after labour 's alan johnson announced he was standing down .
in the 2015 election both labour and the conservatives achieved 5 seats in the region .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: travel news : p & o cancels services between hull and zeebruggee
text: p & o have announced cancellations to several services between hull and zeebrugge .
the services cancelled are :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : rain expected later
text: a dry start but becoming rather cloudy with an increasing chance of showery rain , perhaps heavy with a risk of thunder .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: 2,000 sign petition to save hull mural
text: campaigners fighting to save a mural in hull say it 's an important landmark for the city .
more than 2,000 people have signed a petition for the three ships , which is on the front of the former bhs building to get listed status .
last year the department for culture decided it was n't a good enough example of post-war public art .
the mural itself is a piece of art .
it 's actually the largest mural in england .
it 's not only the mural outside , it 's the mural inside which was recently discovered .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: happy birthday hull 's bee lady
text: happy birthday to hull 's bee lady - jean bishop is 95 today .
there 's a big party happening today at the guildhall in hull to celebrate the bee lady 's birthday .
jean has become a popular sight in hull over the years , collecting money in her costume for age uk .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: exam stress amongst pupils is on the rise
text: there 's been an 11 % rise in the number of teenagers contacting childline about exam stress in the yorkshire and humber region .
it 's a trend that 's being seen across the country as young people start getting ready to sit their gcse and a-level exams .
childline say their counsellors have carried out nearly 150 online sessions in the last two years in yorkshire and the humber .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back with you tomorrow morning from 08:00 but news , sport , weather and travel updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , lets have a look at five things we did n't know this morning :
to finish i thought you might appreciate this short video from a bbc colleague of a dog skateboarding .
a skateboarding pug just crashed into the front doors of our office .
is it not a french bulldog ?
we are sorry .
pugs would never make such a rookie boarder mistake
tbf he is pug-coloured .
so 's a loaf of bread tho
french bulldog surely ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid the excitement of a skateboarding french bulldog got the better of us
omggg i was there why i did n't see him
@ twitterid
me
its me
iiiiiiiiiii
@ twitterid
where can i get one
to be fair i do n't think it 's a pug it looks more like a french bulldog to me but still
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your headlines this evening
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and humber :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : cricket club devastated by fire
text: members of a cricket club near hull say they 're devastated after a suspected arson attack destroyed their pavilion on the village playing fields .
the lawnmowers owned by the skirlaugh club were saved , but the main wooden building and hundreds of pounds worth of cricket equipment was destroyed , just a few weeks into the season .
it 's also just a few days before the annual `` party in the park '' is due to take place on the playing fields .
mike puckering is a member of the cricket club :

documents.title: traffic wo n't be an issue for new fire station
text: humberside fire and rescue says traffic issues in hull city centre wo n't be an problem for the service .
the brigade is officially opening a new central fire station today just off ferensway .
officials have told bbc radio humberside that they have a system in place that allows them to change traffic light patterns to help them negotiate busy roads and the rush hour .
we have a button called a green wave .
when we are called out , we hit that button and the traffic lights change in our favour to where we need to go .
author: Andy Comfort
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : your weather
text: it 's turning cloudier with further showers tomorrow .
see my full forecast below :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: windscreen smash deer lands in girl 's lap
text: windscreen smash deer lands in girl 's lap

documents.title: homeless charity wants people with spare rooms to come forward
text: a charity wants people in hull to consider offering their spare rooms to young people at risk of homelessness .

sash have been working in east yorkshire for a number of years and they vet potential hosts in order to provide young people with somewhere to stay while they wait for appropriate long-term accommodation .
they are now expanding into hull .
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: tigers trust staff to cycle 200 miles in 3 days
text: to mark their last game of the 2016/17 premier league against tottenham , staff at the tigers trust are going to cycle 200 miles in three days .
| @ twitterid staff to take on 200-mile challenge to help raise money for the trust and @ twitterid
| for details on how to support the @ twitterid on their cycle challenge please visit
| for more information about the work that @ twitterid do , please visit
ah good luck guys such a worth while cause .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: rededication of hull church will help role in the community
text: reverends at hull 's holy trinity church are hoping the building 's rededication as a minster will help with their role in the community .
the archbishop of york , dr john sentamu , will lead the service on saturday .
a celebration in holy trinity square will start at 12:00 followed by the official service at 15:00 bst .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: car damaged and deer killed in accident
text: people driving through humberston avenue in grimsby are being told to be aware of deer after one was hit by a car .
lisa auty , whose friends were involved in the incident , said that building work in the area has caused deer to venture into roads , resulting in four accidents in recent weeks .
a mother and daughter in the car at the time were unhurt .
the deer died of its injuries .
this was provided by lisa auty .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: charity wants more community treatment for people with mental health problems
text: a mental health charity in the region has voiced concern that too many people with mental health issues are coming into contact with the police , before they 've receive community based treatment .
the charity mind says some people with problems are n't being identified early enough , which is putting extra pressure on the force .
they say there should be more support in the community for people who find themselves in crisis .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: skirlaugh pavilion fire in
text: look north 's katy austin has been to skirlaugh , where arsonists set fire to the the pavilion .
police say the fire caused extensive damage to the venue .
the cricket club which uses the site say they 're devastated with the damage that 's been caused .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: water pressure failing chalet park residents
text: people living on a chalet park in east yorkshire say they 've been left having to consult with their neighbours if they want a shower .
they say the water pressure at colleys park has been very low for months , and no-one is prepared to help .
yorkshire water says the problem is n't with them and the water pressure 's fine until it gets to the caravan site .
the owners of the site say they 've hired independent investigators to look into the problem .
once their investigations have been concluded , we will be presented with various options to rectify any identified problems . ''
author: Matthew Bone
Video Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and humber :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: child victims of abuse urged to come forward
text: victims of child abuse are being urged to come forward with information and are being reassured their claims will be taken seriously .
the lucy faithfull foundation has spoken to bbc radio humberside after a former foster carer from hull was handed a 19-year-jail sentence for a string of offences against the children in his care .
nationally , cases of child abuse have increased by 20 % due to better police recording and more people coming forward .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: local acts announced for radio 1 's big weekend
text: five up-and-coming acts from hull have been confirmed for the bbc introducing stage at radio one 's big weekend .
the rapper chiedu oraka will be part of the line-up , along with band the hubbards and singer jack conman .
the two day event will be held at burton constable hall at the end of the month .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: honour for hull 's 'bee lady ' ?
text: hull 's bee lady could be granted the freedom of the city .
the ideas is to be discussed at a meeting of hull city council later this afternoon .
jean bishop , who turns ninety five this week , has raised over a hundred thousand pounds for charity .

documents.title: hull 's new fire station has been opened
text: this was the moment hull 's new fire station was officially opened .
the ribbon is cut to open hull 's new central fire station .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Andy Comfort
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: # getsmyvote : 'fairer benefits system '
text: in the run-up to the general election on 8 june , we 're asking people to tell us what # getsmyvote .
lucy peryer , 20 , from driffield , who is a film student at hull school of art and design , says a fairer benefits system is an important issue that 's `` close to my heart '' .
her mum , who is disabled and uses a wheelchair , is assessed every two years and has faced difficulties with `` her benefits being cut off '' , says the budding filmmaker .
she says she would like assessors `` to take a more personal interest in the people 's lives that they 're affecting '' .
they do n't see what she goes through on a day-to-day basis and how much pain she 's in .
the amount of times she 's had her benefits cut off and she 's had to feed three children , cats , a dog and herself on like £ 70 a month . ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shakespeare 's hamlet to come to hull
text: the royal shakespeare company ( rsc ) has announced it will bring the production of hamlet to hull new theatre in february next year .
directed by simon godwin , the production will see rsc associate artist paapa essiedu reprise his award-winning performance .
i ca n't wait to share the experience of our fantastic production of hamlet with audiences at the new theatre . ''
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: arson attack on east yorkshire pavilion
text: arsonists have targeted the pavilion on the playing fields at benningholme lane in skirlaugh .
the fire caused extensive damage and is thought to have been started deliberately .
humberside police are appealing for anyone who saw anything sus
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police appeal for information about missing hull woman
text: humberside police are appealing for help in trying to find 49-year-old renata antczak of beamsley way , hull .
renata was last seen around 13:00 on tuesday 25 april walking in the kingswood area of hull .
she is described as white , 5ft 6in tall , with a slim build and straight shoulder length blond hair .
she was wearing a dark coloured ( blue or black ) trousers and a purple t-shirt .
humberside police would like to speak to anyone who had contact with renata between 08:30 and 13:00 on the 25 april , or who saw a black mercedes c220 car wf13pcx she was using that morning .
author: Crispin Rolfe
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: all yorkshire ambulances now able to deal with obese patients
text: all of yorkshire 's ambulances are capable of carrying obese patients , that 's according to figures released today as part of a bbc investigation .
so-called bariatric ambulances are specially-designed and equipped in response to a 10-fold spike in hospital visits linked to obesity in the past decade
the number of admissions has increased from 52,000 in 2006 to 520,000 in 2016
nhs obesity statistics suggest nearly 60 % of women and 70 % of men are overweight .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: new fire station to open in hull
text: a new city centre fire station is due to open in hull today .
building work was still under way on the central station near to the new theatre yesterday .
it 'll be officially opened in a ceremony this morning .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

text: p & o have cancelled the following ferry sailings due to technical issues :

text: resurfacing work on the a63 that was due to start this weekend has been postponed .
work would have closed the eastbound carriageway from friday to monday .

turning a little cloudier into the afternoon , with a chance of the odd shower , mainly towards the south .
feeling cooler near the coast with an increasing breeze .

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back with you tomorrow morning from 08:00 but news , sport , weather and travel updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , lets have a look at five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: further calls to protect hull mural
text: there are calls to overturn a decision and grant a hull mural listed status .
a proposal was rejected last year to protect the three ships mural by alan boyson which has been on the front of the former bhs building since 1963 .
the grade ii listing would have given it greater protection under planning law in an area which is facing huge redevelopment .

historic england has told bbc radio humberside that the mural was n't given listed status as it 'falls short of the high bar for listing post-war public art ' but the organisation hopes it will remain a part of the city 's streetscape .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: missing north east lincolnshire girl found
text: a teenage girl who went missing in north east lincolnshire has been found safe and well .
lifeboat crews and police were called out on monday night in cleethorpes to look for 15-year-old jordan petty .
police have now issued an update saying she 's been found and they have thanked people who shared the appeal when she went missing .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your weather for tonight and tomorow
text: it 's a fine end to the day with some evening sunshine .
watch my full forecast below :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: carer child sex abuse 'devastating '
text: carer child sex abuse 'devastating '

documents.title: hull marina lock gates fixed
text: the lock gates at hull marina have now been fixed after two weeks of closure .
boats had n't been able to leave or enter the marina .
it 's means the archbishop of york will be able to arrive by boat to attend a service on saturday when mean holy trinity church becomes hull minster .
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: scunthorpe speed camera 'one of the britain 's most lucrative '
text: the m180 is nearly at the top of a list of britain 's roads with the most lucrative speed cameras .
the report was collated by insurers after freedom of information requests were submitted to britain 's biggest police forces .
the report says the m180 near scunthorpe brought in almost £ 584,000 in 2015 .
author: Crispin Rolfe
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: work begins to improve east yorkshire 's roads
text: over £ 2m is being spent by the east riding of yorkshire council on improving the area 's roads .
around 15,000 tonnes of stone chippings will be laid on around 650,000 square metres of roads .
now 160 sites will be re-surfaced across the east riding of yorkshire .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull trinity church gets ready to become a minster
text: in just a few days hull 's holy trinity church will become a minster .
the archbishop of york dr john sentamu will declare the church a minster this weekend .
the church is undergoing a multi-million pound facelift .
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: radio 1 to announce more acts for the big weekend
text: radio 1 will announce its line-up for the introducing stage at the big weekend on 27/28 may .
the event will be held this year at burton constable .
the announcement will be made on the huw stephens ' show from 22:00 bst .
tune in to @ twitterid show tonight from 10pm on @ twitterid to discover our awesome line up for # bigweekend
fingers crossed for @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
author: BBC Radio 1

documents.title: 'good samaritan ' reunited with woman she helped
text: a woman from hull has been reunited with one of the good samaritans who came to her aid when she had a seizure while driving .
sarah garlick ( on the right ) has no memory of the accident and says it could have been much worse if nobody had stopped to help .
kim pythian ( on the left ) helped make the car safe and stayed with sarah until paramedics arrived .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police search river at stamford bridge for missing woman
text: police are searching parts of the river derwent at stamford bridge after reports of a woman being seen in the water .
the police helicopter was used in part of the search on wednesday after officers were told of a missing 80-year-old woman .
humberside police said an extensive search of the area has been conducted but there is no sign of the missing woman .
officers are appealing for any information about the incident to contact them .

documents.title: hull 2017 : what 's on this week
text: here 's kofi with what you can see in hull later this week as part of the year as city of culture
we 've got your weekend sorted : dance , documentaries , medieval minstrels and minster-making .
@ docnrollfest @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: half a million pounds to be invested in north east lincolnshire academies
text: half a million pounds is being invested in schools in north east lincolnshire by an academy trust .
tollbar multi academy trust is investing the money into reynolds academy in cleethorpes where a new classroom is being built and tollbar sixth form college in new waltham .
the trust says the money is being invested because student numbers are growing .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and the humber this lunchtime :
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel magazine labels hull 'a city to miss '
text: magazine which ?
travel has labelled hull 'a city to miss , ' despite being uk city of culture .
the magazine says that despite having some attractive headline art and cultural events , the city is a long way from `` pretty much everywhere '' .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: not the cat in the hat again ?
text: a siberian husky is being praised for helping pupils at an east yorkshire school improve their reading skills .
shara joins pupils in the library at longcroft school in beverley .
she 's a reading dog and her job is to sit and listen
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: have your say : hull busker asked to move from poppy display
text: a row about buskers ' rights has blown up in hull .
jonny walker from leeds says police were called when he performed near the poppy installation in queen victoria square .
hull city council says buskers are encouraged but that mr walker was disrespectful to play in an area temporarily set aside for quiet reflection .
here 's what some of you think :
jonny walker is doing no harm to anyone , all he is doing is trying to bring joy to the people of hull and visitors who come to hull . ''
there are plenty of places to busk .
do n't make an issue of it , have a little respect and just busk in another area nearby . ''
i agree that victoria square and the area around the poppies should be kept clear of buskers .
it 's not like there are n't plenty of other busy places around town . ''
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: cycling experts discuss road safety in hull
text: cycling experts from across the uk are in hull .
they 're discussing schemes to get more people riding bikes and have this message to road users .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: grimsby town release skipper disley
text: grimsby town release skipper disley

documents.title: ice cream van stolen in beverley
text: humberside police are appealing for help to identify a man following the theft of an ice cream van on victoria road in beverley .
the van , which was stolen in the early hours of wednesday 26 april , is a cream-coloured ford transit van with `` french 's '' written on the side .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: care home workers to stay in 'haunted ' house
text: staff from a care home in hornsea are sleeping out in one of hull 's most `` haunted '' houses tonight .
they 're staying at 39 de grey street to raise money for a girl from hornsea who has cerebral palsy .
the group of 10 from willow garth who look after people with long-term illness and special needs are going in to the house this evening .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hurst 'looks to former club ' for players
text: shrewsbury town 's manager , paul hurst , is thought to be looking at full back zak mills and goalkeeper james mckeown - both from his former club , grimsby .
however , the town may have scuppered their chances of signing anyone from grimsby , after taking hurst and his assistant chris doig from the league two side back in october .
hurst is keeping quiet about the player speculation , but insists the relationship between the clubs is a good one .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: a63 eastbound to close over next three weekends
text: nine miles of the a63 will be closed eastbound between south cave and welton on three forthcoming weekends .
it 's to allow for re-surfacing work .
the dates are :
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: puffins return to flamborough cliffs
text: the yorkshire wildlife trust says puffins have returned to flamborough cliffs to breed .
the uk 's only mainland puffin colony has returned to breed !
see them at flamborough cliffs .
plan your trip at
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concerns over speeding in sewerby
text: there are concerns there will be a serious accident before more is done to stop speeding drivers in sewerby .

residents have launched a petition to get more speed cameras in the east yorkshire village , after a survey revealed more than half the vehicles travelling down the main roads are breaking the 20 mph speed limit .

the east riding of yorkshire council says a speed survey in 2015 demonstrated that the majority of drivers were breaking the 20mph speed limit , sewerby has a good road safety record and does not warrant further traffic calming measures .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: neighbours ' relief after child sex abuser jailed
text: neighbours of a child sex abuser in hull who first raised concerns about his behaviour seven years ago say they 're relieved he 's finally been sentenced for his crimes .
this week the 64-year-old , who was also a foster carer , was jailed for 19 years .
people who lived next door recorded noises from the house after they became sus
these are the words of one the neighbours voiced by an actor in order to protect the identities of the victims .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : dry and becoming warm
text: a dry day becoming warm after a chilly start with large amounts of sunshine .
some patchy cloud forming later .
the highest temperatures will be inland , as cool sea breezes develop along the coast .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

text: here are the latest headlines across east yorkshire and humber :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: our live coverage across east yorkshire and the humber
text: good morning and welcome to today 's live feed across east yorkshire & humber on wednesday 10 may 2017 .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if there 's anything you 'd like to get in touch with me about , you can do so via email , facebook and twitter .
author: Jonathan Willis

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back with you tomorrow morning from 08:00 but news , sport , weather and travel updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , lets have a look at five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Kimberley Metcalfe
BBC Local Live, Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: hidden treasures of the wolds revealed
text: the yorkshire wolds way is 79 miles long , through pretty , quaint countryside .
and may possibly wend its way right past your front door .
with that in mind it makes absolute sense it has it 's own television show .
presenter paul rose takes to the trail from hessle to filey , exploring what the route has to offer along the way .
'yorkshire wolds way ' is on bbc 2 on saturday 13 may at 19:30 .
author: BBC Two
